author: KirkMunro
body:
# PR Summary

Expands line continuance for pipelines to allow lines to continue automatically without backticks with the pipe symbol at the start of a line. This adds to the existing functionality where pipes can be used to continue lines by placing them at the end of a line.

Supported methods to wrap pipelines that existed before this PR:

```powershell
# Wrapping with a pipe at the end of a line
Get-Process | Where CPU | Where Path |
    Get-Item | Where FullName -match "AppData" | 
    Sort FullName -Unique
```

```powershell
# Wrapping with a backtick at the end of a line and a pipe at the beginning of a line
Get-Process | Where CPU | Where Path `
    | Get-Item | Where FullName -match "AppData" `
    | Sort FullName -Unique
```

Additional supported methods to wrap pipelines with this PR in place:

```powershell
# Wrapping with a pipe at the beginning of a line (no backtick required)
Get-Process | Where CPU | Where Path
    | Get-Item | Where FullName -match "AppData"
    | Sort FullName -Unique
```

```powershell
# Wrapping with a pipe on a line by itself (this comes automatically with
# the addition of parser support for wrapping with a pipe at the beginning
# of a line since PowerShell already supported wrapping with a pipe at the
# end of a line)
Get-Process | Where CPU | Where Path
    |
    Get-Item | Where FullName -match "AppData"
    |
    Sort FullName -Unique
```

## PR Context

See #3020.

comments.author: KirkMunro
comments.body:
Removed WIP tag in title. Pushed logic that requires code to be contiguous for automatic line continuance to work. Updated Pester tests to check for multiple types of whitespace (identified from code), and added new test to ensure that automatic line continuance with pipe on the start of a line only works when lines are contiguous.

This is PR now ready for final review/merge.

title: Support line continuance with pipe at the start of a line
